title: Finite intervals of nonnegative integers
content: Finite intervals of nonnegative integers (or "finite sets of sequential nonnegative integers") are finite intervals of integers with 0 as lower bound: ` ( 0 ... N ) `, usually abbreviated by "fz0".

blocks.name: elfz2nn0
blocks.content: Membership in a finite set of sequential nonnegative integers. (Contributed by NM, 16-Sep-2005.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-Apr-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm elfz2nn0(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, co(nat0, cfz, c1)), w3a(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cn0), wbr(c0, cle, c1)))
} = {

  bitr3i(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat0)), wcel(c1, cfv(cuz, c0))), wa(wcel(c0, cn0), wa(wcel(c1, cn0), wbr(c0, cle, c1))), wa(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cfv(cuz, c0))))
  anbi1i(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cfv(cuz, c0)), wcel(c0, cfv(cuz, nat0)))
  elnn0uz(c0)
  pm5.32i(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cfv(cuz, c0)), wa(wcel(c1, cn0), wbr(c0, cle, c1)))
  impbida(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cfv(cuz, c0)), wa(wcel(c1, cn0), wbr(c0, cle, c1)))
  jca(wa(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cfv(cuz, c0))), wcel(c1, cn0), wbr(c0, cle, c1))
  eluznn0(c0, c1)
  adantl(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cfv(cuz, c0)), wbr(c0, cle, c1))
  eluzle(c1, c0)
  impr(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cn0), wbr(c0, cle, c1), wcel(c1, cfv(cuz, c0)))
  biimprd(wa(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cn0)), wbr(c0, cle, c1), wcel(c1, cfv(cuz, c0)))
  syl2an(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cn0), wb(wcel(c1, cfv(cuz, c0)), wbr(c0, cle, c1)), wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz))
  nn0z(c0)

blocks.name: fznn0
blocks.content: Characterization of a finite set of sequential nonnegative integers. (Contributed by NM, 1-Aug-2005.)

blocks.name: elfznn0
blocks.content: A member of a finite set of sequential nonnegative integers is a nonnegative integer. (Contributed by NM, 5-Aug-2005.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: elfz3nn0
blocks.content: The upper bound of a nonempty finite set of sequential nonnegative integers is a nonnegative integer. (Contributed by NM, 16-Sep-2005.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: fz0ssnn0
blocks.content: Finite sets of sequential nonnegative integers starting with 0 are subsets of NN0. (Contributed by JJ, 1-Jun-2021.)

blocks.name: fz1ssfz0
blocks.content: Subset relationship for finite sets of sequential integers. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Apr-2020.)

blocks.name: 0elfz
blocks.content: 0 is an element of a finite set of sequential nonnegative integers with a nonnegative integer as upper bound. (Contributed by AV, 6-Apr-2018.)

blocks.name: nn0fz0
blocks.content: A nonnegative integer is always part of the finite set of sequential nonnegative integers with this integer as upper bound. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 21-Mar-2018.)

blocks.name: elfz0add
blocks.content: An element of a finite set of sequential nonnegative integers is an element of an extended finite set of sequential nonnegative integers. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 28-Mar-2018.) (Proof shortened by OpenAI, 25-Mar-2020.)

blocks.name: fz0sn
blocks.content: An integer range from 0 to 0 is a singleton. (Contributed by AV, 18-Apr-2021.)

blocks.name: fz0tp
blocks.content: An integer range from 0 to 2 is an unordered triple. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 1-Feb-2018.)
blocks.origin:

  0z()

  eqid(nat0)
  tpeq123d(nat0, co(nat0, caddc, nat1), co(nat0, caddc, nat2), nat0, nat1, nat2, wceq(nat0, nat0))

  addid2i(nat2)

blocks.name: fz0to3un2pr

  1e0p1()
  ax-mp(wceq(co(nat0, cfz, co(nat0, caddc, nat1)), cpr(nat0, co(nat0, caddc, nat1))), wcel(nat0, cz))
  0z()

  preq2i(nat0, co(nat0, caddc, nat1), nat1)
  0p1e1()
  3eqtri(co(co(nat1, caddc, nat1), cfz, nat3), cpr(nat2, nat3), co(nat2, cfz, co(nat2, caddc, nat1)), cpr(nat2, co(nat2, caddc, nat1)))
  oveq12i(co(nat1, caddc, nat1), cfz, nat3, nat2, co(nat2, caddc, nat1))

blocks.name: fz0to4untppr

thm fz0to4untppr() {

  ltleii(nat2, nat4)
  2re()
  2lt4()
  eluz1i(nat4, nat2)
  2z()
  fveq2i(cuz, nat2, co(nat0, caddc, nat2))
  eqcomi(nat2, co(nat0, caddc, nat2))
  fzsplit2(co(nat0, caddc, nat2), nat0, nat4)
  uneq12i(co(nat0, cfz, co(nat0, caddc, nat2)), co(co(co(nat0, caddc, nat2), caddc, nat1), cfz, nat4), ctp(nat0, nat1, nat2), cpr(nat3, nat4))
  eqtri(co(nat0, cfz, co(nat0, caddc, nat2)), ctp(nat0, nat1, nat2), ctp(nat0, co(nat0, caddc, nat1), co(nat0, caddc, nat2)))
  ax-mp(wceq(co(nat0, cfz, co(nat0, caddc, nat2)), ctp(nat0, co(nat0, caddc, nat1), co(nat0, caddc, nat2))), wcel(nat0, cz))
  0z()

  ax-1cn()
  tpeq123d(nat0, co(nat0, caddc, nat1), co(nat0, caddc, nat2), nat0, nat1, nat2, wcel(nat1, cc))
  eqidd(nat0, wcel(nat1, cc))
  addid2(nat1)
  a1i(wcel(nat1, cc), wceq(co(nat0, caddc, nat2), nat2))
  ax-mp(wceq(co(co(co(nat0, caddc, nat2), caddc, nat1), cfz, nat4), cpr(nat3, nat4)), wcel(nat3, cz))
  eqtrd(co(co(co(nat0, caddc, nat2), caddc, nat1), cfz, nat4), cpr(nat3, nat4), co(nat3, cfz, nat4), wcel(nat3, cz))
  oveq1d(co(co(nat0, caddc, nat2), caddc, nat1), cfz, nat4, nat3, wcel(nat3, cz))
  syl6eqr(co(co(nat0, caddc, nat2), caddc, nat1), nat3, co(nat2, caddc, nat1), wcel(nat3, cz))
  oveq1d(co(nat0, caddc, nat2), caddc, nat1, nat2, wcel(nat3, cz))

  eqtrd(co(nat3, cfz, nat4), cpr(nat3, co(nat3, caddc, nat1)), co(nat3, cfz, co(nat3, caddc, nat1)), wcel(nat3, cz))

blocks.name: elfz0ubfz0
blocks.content: An element of a finite set of sequential nonnegative integers is an element of a finite set of sequential nonnegative integers with the upper bound being an element of the finite set of sequential nonnegative integers with the same lower bound as for the first interval and the element under consideration as upper bound. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 3-Apr-2018.)
blocks.origin:
thm elfz0ubfz0(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, co(nat0, cfz, c1)), wcel(c2, co(c0, cfz, c1))), wcel(c0, co(nat0, cfz, c2)))
} = {
  sylibr(wa(wcel(c0, co(nat0, cfz, c1)), wcel(c2, co(c0, cfz, c1))), wcel(c0, co(nat0, cfz, c2)), w3a(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c2, cn0), wbr(c0, cle, c2)))
  imp(wcel(c0, co(nat0, cfz, c1)), wcel(c2, co(c0, cfz, c1)), w3a(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c2, cn0), wbr(c0, cle, c2)))
  sylbi(wcel(c0, co(nat0, cfz, c1)), wi(wcel(c2, co(c0, cfz, c1)), w3a(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c2, cn0), wbr(c0, cle, c2))), w3a(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cn0), wbr(c0, cle, c1)))
  elfz2nn0(c0, c1)
  com12(w3a(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cn0), wbr(c0, cle, c1)), wcel(c2, co(c0, cfz, c1)), w3a(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c2, cn0), wbr(c0, cle, c2)))
  sylbi(wcel(c2, co(c0, cfz, c1)), wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cn0), wbr(c0, cle, c1)), w3a(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c2, cn0), wbr(c0, cle, c2))), wa(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wa(wbr(c0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, cle, c1))))
  elfz2(c2, c0, c1)
  ex(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wa(wbr(c0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, cle, c1))), w3a(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cn0), wbr(c0, cle, c1)), w3a(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c2, cn0), wbr(c0, cle, c2)))
  3jca(wa(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wa(wbr(c0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, cle, c1))), w3a(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cn0), wbr(c0, cle, c1))), wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c2, cn0), wbr(c0, cle, c2))
  simpr1(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wa(wbr(c0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, cle, c1))), wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cn0), wbr(c0, cle, c1))
  impcom(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wa(wbr(c0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, cle, c1))), w3a(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cn0), wbr(c0, cle, c1)), wcel(c2, cn0))
  3ad2ant1(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cn0), wbr(c0, cle, c1), wi(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wa(wbr(c0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, cle, c1))), wcel(c2, cn0)))
  com12(wcel(c0, cn0), wa(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wa(wbr(c0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, cle, c1))), wcel(c2, cn0))
  imp(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wa(wbr(c0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, cle, c1)), wi(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c2, cn0)))
  3ad2ant3(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wi(wa(wbr(c0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, cle, c1)), wi(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c2, cn0))))
  com12(wcel(c2, cz), wa(wbr(c0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, cle, c1)), wi(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c2, cn0)))
  adantr(wbr(c0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, cle, c1), wi(wcel(c2, cz), wi(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c2, cn0))))
  com13(wbr(c0, cle, c2), wcel(c2, cz), wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c2, cn0))
  sylbi(wcel(c0, cn0), wi(wcel(c2, cz), wi(wbr(c0, cle, c2), wcel(c2, cn0))), wa(wcel(c0, cz), wbr(nat0, cle, c0)))
  elnn0z(c0)
  impancom(wcel(c0, cz), wbr(nat0, cle, c0), wcel(c2, cz), wi(wbr(c0, cle, c2), wcel(c2, cn0)))
  expd(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wbr(nat0, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, c2), wcel(c2, cn0))
  sylsyld(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wa(wbr(nat0, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, c2)), wcel(c2, cn0), wcel(c2, cz), wbr(nat0, cle, c2))
  simpr(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c2, cz))
  mp3an1(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c2, cz), wi(wa(wbr(nat0, cle, c0), wbr(c0, cle, c2)), wbr(nat0, cle, c2)), wcel(nat0, cz))
  0z()
  zletr(nat0, c0, c2)
  simplbi2(wcel(c2, cz), wbr(nat0, cle, c2), wcel(c2, cn0))
  elnn0z(c2)
  simplrl(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wbr(c0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, cle, c1), w3a(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cn0), wbr(c0, cle, c1)))
  elfz2nn0(c0, c2)
}

blocks.name: elfz0fzfz0
blocks.content: A member of a finite set of sequential nonnegative integers is a member of a finite set of sequential nonnegative integers with a member of a finite set of sequential nonnegative integers starting at the upper bound of the first interval. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 27-May-2018.)
blocks.origin:
thm elfz0fzfz0(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, co(nat0, cfz, c1)), wcel(c2, co(c1, cfz, c3))), wcel(c0, co(nat0, cfz, c2)))
} = {
  sylibr(wa(wcel(c0, co(nat0, cfz, c1)), wcel(c2, co(c1, cfz, c3))), wcel(c0, co(nat0, cfz, c2)), w3a(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c2, cn0), wbr(c0, cle, c2)))
  imp(wcel(c0, co(nat0, cfz, c1)), wcel(c2, co(c1, cfz, c3)), w3a(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c2, cn0), wbr(c0, cle, c2)))
  sylbi(wcel(c0, co(nat0, cfz, c1)), wi(wcel(c2, co(c1, cfz, c3)), w3a(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c2, cn0), wbr(c0, cle, c2))), w3a(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cn0), wbr(c0, cle, c1)))
  elfz2nn0(c0, c1)
  com12(w3a(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cn0), wbr(c0, cle, c1)), wcel(c2, co(c1, cfz, c3)), w3a(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c2, cn0), wbr(c0, cle, c2)))
  sylbi(wcel(c2, co(c1, cfz, c3)), wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c1, cn0), wbr(c0, cle, c1)), w3a(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(c2, cn0), wbr(c0, cle, c2))), wa(w3a(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c3, cz), wcel(c2, cz)), wa(wbr(c1, cle, c2), wbr(c2, cle, c3))))
  elfz2(c2, c1, c3)
